name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: [MUSIC]

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: This lecture is a overview of text retrieval methods.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: In the previous lecture we introduced you to the problem of text retrieval.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: We explained that the main problem is to design a ranking function to rank

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: documents for a query.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _In this lecture

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: we will give a overview of different ways of designing this ranking function.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: So the problem is the following.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _We have a query that has a sequence of words
column6: and _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _a document that
column6: that's also a sequence of words
column7: and we hope to define the function _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: f that can compute a score based on the query and document.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: So the main challenge you here is with designing a good ranking function that can

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _rank all the relevant documents
column6: on top of all the non-relevant ones. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: Now clearly this means our function must be able to measure

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: the likelihood that a document d is relevant to a query q.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: That also means we have to have some way to define relevance.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: In particular in order to implement the program to do that we have to have

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _a computational definition of relevance
column6: and we achieve this goal by _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _designing a retrieval model
column6: which gives us a formalization of relevance. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Now
column6: over many decades

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _many different kinds of retrieval models
column6: and they fall into different categories. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _First
column6: one fair many of the models are based on the similarity idea. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Basically
column6: we assume that if a document is more similar to the query _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _than another document is

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: then we would say the first document is more relevant than the second one.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _So in this case
column6: the ranking function is defined as _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: the similarity between the query and the document.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _One well known example in this case is vector space model

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: which we will cover more in detail later in the lecture.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: The second kind of models are called probabilistic models.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _In this family of models
column6: we follow a very different strategy. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: While we assume that queries and

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _documents are all observations from random variables
column6: and _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _we assume there is a binary random variable called R here

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: to indicate whether a document is relevant to a query.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: We then define the score of document with respect to a query as is a probability

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _that this random variable R is equal to 1
column6: given a particular document and query. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: There are different cases of such a general idea.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _One is classic probabilistic model
column6: another is language model

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: another is divergence-from-randomness model.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _In a later lecture
column6: we will talk more about the

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: which is language model.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: The third kind of models of this is probabilistic inference.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: So here the idea is to associate uncertainty to inference rules.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: And we can then quantify the probability that we can show that the query

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: follows from the document.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Finally
column6: there is also a family of models that are using axiomatic thinking. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: Here the idea is to define a set of constraints that

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: we hope a good retrieval function to satisfy.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: So in this case the problem is you seek

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: a good ranking function that can satisfy all the desired constraints.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Interestingly
column6: although these different models are based on different thinking

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: in the end the retrieval function tends to be very similar.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: And these functions tend to also involve similar variables.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _So now let's take a look at the
column6: the common form of a state of that retrieval _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: model and examine some of the common ideas used in all these models.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _First
column6: these models are all based on the assumption _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: of using bag of words for representing text.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: And we explained this in the natural language processing lecture.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: Bag of words representation remains the main representation used in all

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: the search engines.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _So
column6: with this assumption
column7: the score of a query like a presidential _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _campaign news
column6: with respect to a document d here

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _would be based on scores computed at
column6: based on each individual word. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _And that means the score would depend on the score of each word

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _such as presidential
column6: campaign

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Here we can see there are three different components

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: each corresponding to how well the document matches each of the query words.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Inside of these functions
column6: we see a number of heuristics views. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _So for example
column6: one factor that affects the function g here is how _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: many times does the word presidential occur in the document?

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: This is called a Term Frequency or TF.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: We might also denote as c of presidential and d.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: In general if the word occurs more frequently in

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: the document then the value of this function would be larger.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Another factor is how long is the document
column6: and _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: this is so to use the document length for score.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _In general
column6: if a term occurs in a long _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _document that many times
column6: it's not as significant as _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: if it occurred the same number of times in a short document.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: Because in the long document any term is expected to occur more frequently.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Finally
column6: there is this factor called a document frequency

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: want to look at how often presidential occurs in the entire collection.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _And we call this Document Frequency
column6: or DF

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: And in some other models we might also use a probability

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: to characterize this information.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _So here
column6: I show the probability of presidential in the collection. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: So all these are trying to characterize the popularity of

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: the term in the collection.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _In general
column6: matching a rare term in the collection _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: is contributing more to the overall score then matching a common term.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: So this captures some of the main ideas used in pretty much all the state of

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: the art retrieval models.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _So now
column6: a natural question is which model works the best? _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Now
column6: it turns out that many models work equally well
column7: so here I listed the four _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: major models that are generally regarded as a state of the art retrieval models.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Pivoted length normalization
column6: BM25

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _When optimized these models tend to perform similarly and this was

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: discussed in detail in this reference at the end of this lecture.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Among all these
column6: BM25 is probably the most popular. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _It's most likely that this has been used in virtually all the search engines

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: and you will also often see this method discussed in research papers.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: And we'll talk more about this method later in some other lectures.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _So
column6: to summarize
column7: the main points made in this lecture are

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _of a good ranking function pre-requires a computational definition of relevance
column6: and _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: we achieve this goal by designing a proper retrieval model.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Second
column6: many models are equally effective but we don't have a single winner here. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Researchers are still actively working on this problem

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: trying to find a truly optimal retrieval model.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Finally
column6: the state of the art ranking functions tend to rely on _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: the following ideas.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _First
column6: bag of words representation. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _Second
column6: TF and the document frequency of words. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: Such information is used when ranking function to determine

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _the overall contribution of matching a word
column6: and document length. _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: These are often combined in interesting ways and we'll discuss

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: how exactly they are combined to rank documents in the lectures later.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: There are two suggested additional readings if you have time.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: The first is a paper where you can find a detailed discussion and

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: comparison of multiple state of the art models.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: _The second
column6: is a book with a chapter that gives a broad review of _

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: different retrieval models.

name: 2 - 4 - 1.4 Overview of Text Retrieval Methods (00-10-10).srt
text: [MUSIC]
